headline: Take-Two (TTWO) Reports Q1 Earnings: What Key Metrics Have to Say
summary: The headline numbers for Take-Two (TTWO) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended June 2025, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

headline: Take-Two Interactive (TTWO) Beats Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Take-Two (TTWO) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +125.93% and +10.71%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Take-Two’s (NASDAQ:TTWO) Q2: Beats On Revenue, Full-Year Outlook Exceeds Expectations
summary: Video game publisher Take Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 12.4% year on year to $1.50 billion. Revenue guidance for the full year exceeded analysts’ estimates, but next quarter’s guidance of $1.68 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.2% below expectations. Its GAAP loss of $0.07 per share was 90.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Pinterest Q2 profit miss, Block Q2 revenue miss, Take-Two Q1 beat
summary: Pinterest (PINS) stock falls after a second quarter profit miss. Block (XYZ) missed on second quarter revenue and earnings. Take-Two (TTWO) stock is climbing after a first quarter earnings beat, reporting $0.61 adjusted earnings per share (EPS) versus the $0.29 expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Take-Two shares rise on strong net bookings, upbeat forecast ahead of new GTA
summary: Investing.com -- Take-Two Interactive Software Inc (NASDAQ:TTWO) shares climbed 5% in after-hours trading Thursday after the videogame publisher reported robust top-line growth and raised its full-year outlook, offsetting a disappointing bottom line. Enthusiasm around Grand Theft Auto VI and strong contributions from franchises across console and mobile platforms buoyed investor confidence.

headline: Take-Two Tops June-Quarter Targets, Touts Ambitious Game Pipeline
summary: Video game publisher Take-Two Interactive Software crushed Wall Street's targets for its fiscal Q1 and raised its full-year guidance.

headline: Take-Two: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had a loss of 7 cents. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and stock option expense, were 61 cents per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Take-Two: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had a loss of 7 cents. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and stock option expense, were 61 cents per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Take-Two lifts annual bookings forecast on 'Mafia', 'Borderlands' launches
summary: (Reuters) -Take-Two Interactive raised its annual bookings forecast on Thursday, betting on strong demand for its new "Mafia" and "Borderlands" titles, sending its shares up 5% in extended trading.  The firm stuck to the May 26 launch date for its highly awaited "Grand Theft Auto VI," which is expected to generate billions of dollars within weeks of its release.  Take-Two is banking on "Mafia: The Old Country", "Borderlands 4" and its core sports titles to drive growth in the absence of "Grand Theft Auto VI" against the backdrop of industry-wide struggles with challenging economic conditions.

headline: Take-Two Interactive Software Raises Fiscal-Year Outlook on Improved First-Quarter Results
summary: Chief Executive  Strauss Zelnick  said the updated outlook reflects strong results in its latest quarter, boosted by continuing demand for its core franchises.  In its fiscal first quarter, Take-Two narrowed its loss to $11.9 million, or 7 cents a share, compared with a loss of $262 million, or $1.52 a share, a year earlier.

headline: Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. Reports Results for Fiscal First Quarter 2026
summary: NEW YORK, August 07, 2025--Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ:TTWO) today reported results for the first quarter of its fiscal year 2026, ended June 30, 2025. For further information, please see the first quarter fiscal 2026 results slide deck posted to the Company’s investor relations website at take2games.com/ir.
